sub_concepts.name: Atomic Structure
sub_concepts.definition: The study of the arrangement of atoms within a molecule.

sub_concepts.name: Molecular Bonding
sub_concepts.definition: The formation of chemical bonds between atoms to form a molecule.

sub_concepts.name: Molecular Shapes
sub_concepts.definition: The study of the three-dimensional structure of molecules and how they are influenced by the bonding and electron density.

sub_concepts.name: Intermolecular Forces
sub_concepts.definition: The attractive or repulsive forces that exist between molecules.

sub_concepts.name: Solubility
sub_concepts.definition: The ability of a substance to dissolve in another substance.

sub_concepts.name: Acids and Bases
sub_concepts.definition: Substances that donate or accept electrons to form salts.

sub_concepts.name: Chemical Reactions
sub_concepts.definition: The transformation of one or more substances into another substance.

sub_concepts.name: Stoichiometry
sub_concepts.definition: The study of the quantitative relationships between reactants and products in chemical reactions.
